plain: 12 Monkeys, Judge Dredd, Terminator 2, Dr. Strangelove, 2001: A Space Odyssey, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, Star Wars Episode IV, Star Wars Episode V, Star Wars Episode VI, Star Trek: First Contact, Star Trek VI, Star Trek II, Batman Returns, Sneakers, The Lost World: Jurassic Park, Men in Black, Contact, Starship Troopers, Lost in Space, The X-Files, Armageddon, Star Trek: Insurrection, The Matrix, Star Wars Episode I, Total Recall, Galaxy Quest, Mad Max: These movies are all science fiction, fantasy, or action movies. They all have complex plots, often involving time travel, space travel, or alternate realities. The musical scores are often epic and grand, with a mood that ranges from intense to melancholy. The settings are varied, from outer space to post-apocalyptic Earth. The visual styles are also varied, ranging from realistic to cartoonish. The writing styles are also varied, ranging from serious to humorous. The runtimes are typically long, as these movies often have complex stories that require a lot of screen time to unfold. The themes are also varied, but often involve questions of identity, morality, and the nature of reality.
